definition: lit. paper has become expensive in Luoyang (because everyone is making a copy of a popular story) (idiom)/fig. (of a product) to sell like hotcakes
used in transliteration
surname Luo/old name of several rivers (in Henan, Shaanxi, Sichuan and Anhui)
positive (electric.)/sun/male principle (Taoism)/Yang, opposite: 陰|阴[yin1]
paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc
variant of 紙|纸[zhi3]
expensive/noble/precious/(honorific) your
to compete/to fight for/to rush to purchase
to sell out/to run out (of supplies)/deficient/lack of supplies
to be popular for a while/to be all the rage for a time
to copy (a text) from person to person/(of a text) to be transmitted by copying
(idiom) town gossip/streetcorner conversations
understood by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
lit. enough books to make a pack-ox sweat or to fill a house to the rafters (idiom); fig. many books
the multitudes come out from everywhere, emptying every alleyway (to celebrate)/the whole town turns out
one word worth a thousand in gold (idiom)/(in praise of a piece of writing or calligraphy) each character is perfect/each word is highly valued
to copy/to pass on a copy
sensational effect/wild reaction
to write a flawless essay in one go (idiom)/to be quick-witted and skilled at writing compositions
